devops.subject: DEVOPS-USER and DEVOPS-KEY Required after Aug 19th, 2019
message: Currently, if no PINGIDENTITY_DEVOPS_USER or PINGIDENTITY_DEVOPS_KEY
are provided, a default evaluation user/key is used.
After August 19th, 2019, the evaluation user/key will no longer be
available, and a personal DEVOPS_USER/DEVOPS_KEY will be required.
Details on obtaining these can be found at:

devops.subject: EULA explicit acceptance is now required
message: Continued use of the Ping Identity Docker container constitute acceptance of the Terms of Use of Ping Identity software.

devops.subject: PING_CONTAINER_PRIVILEGED will default to false
message: Set PING_CONTAINER_PRIVILEGED to false and verify that everything works in your environment, the Ping Identity Docker images will default to non-root run time PID starting 2020-Feb-01
Continued use of the Ping Identity Docker container constitute acceptance of the Terms of Use of Ping Identity software.

pingaccess.subject: *** PingAccess 6.1.0 data.json support ***
message: PA 6.1.0 now natively supports data.json ingestion
This is the recommended approach. More info:

pingdatasync.subject: **** pingdatasync v8 images now use pd.profile *****
message: With the version 8 pingdatasync images, they now use
manage-profile setup to build images.  This will expect to
find items like dsconfig to reside under pd.profile/dsconfig

ldap-sdk-tools.subject: Example commands to search/test Ping Directory instances

pingfederate.subject: *** PingFederate Security Vulnerability ***
message: PingFederate deployments prior to sprint release 2108 (Aug 27th, 2021) may be at risk.
for details on impacted and patched versions.
